subject: Law
title: Actus Reus: The Guilty Act
description: Learn Actus Reus: The Guilty Act in one minute.

hook.text: Thinking about robbing a bank isn't a crime. Walking in with a mask and a note is. The law punishes acts, not thoughts.

buildup.text: Actus reus means the 'guilty act'â€”the physical action or omission that constitutes a crime.

discovery.text: It can be an act (pulling a trigger), an omission (failing to report abuse), or a state of being (possession).

twist.text: The act must be voluntary. Crimes committed during sleepwalking or seizures may lack actus reus entirely.

climax.text: Prosecutors must prove the defendant did somethingâ€”or failed to do something legally required.

punchline.text: Thoughts alone are never criminal. Actions are.
